top | V3 Shortly after [the deportation]
Here lies
Leib and his father David Kirschner
Who were murdered on the 15th day
Of September in the year 1942
By the Nazi thugs
In Korczyna

 

[1] TUZ PO [CZYWALA]
SZCZATKI ZWŁOK
KIRSCHNERA
WOŁFA I SYNA
JEGO DAWIDA
LEIBA POMORDO...
 ...WANYCH DNIA
15 SPN 1942 RK [ROKU]
PRZEZ ZBIROW
HITLEROWSKIGH
W KORCZYNIE

[1] This is stone is recounted in the Yizkor book of Korczyna. David Kirschner and his son Leib hid from the Nazis during the liquidation of the Korczyna Ghetto in this cemetery. When they saw that all had gone, they returned and dug a grave for themselves. They were soon captured, and requested that they be brought to the cemetery. There, they were shot in the grave that they had dug for themselves, embracing one another. Years later a relative came and erected this monument as a living memorial.

 

Version 3

1TUZ PO [CZYWALA]
SZCZATKI ZWŁOK
KIRSCHNERA
WOŁFA I SYNA
JEGO DAWIDA
LEIBA POMORDO...
...WANYCH DNIA
15 SPN 1942 RK [ROKU]
PRZEZ ZBIROW
HITLEROWSKIGH
W KORCZYNIE

Shortly after [the deportation]
Here lies
Leib and his father David Kirschner
Who were murdered on the 15th day
Of September in the year 1942
By the Nazi thugs
In Korczyna

1This is stone is recounted in the Yizkor book of Korczyna. David Kirschner and his son Leib hid from the Nazis during the liquidation of the Korczyna Ghetto in this cemetery. When they saw that all had gone, they returned and dug a grave for themselves. They were soon captured, and requested that they be brought to the cemetery. There, they were shot in the grave that they had dug for themselves, embracing one another. Years later a relative came and erected this monument as a living memorial.

 כתר תורה
 איש נכבד חסיד וישר
 כל ימיו עסק בצדקה ובגח
 מכספו נתן לעניים ואביונים
 ולרעבים נתן לאכול על של חנו
 ומסתופף בצל הצדיקים הר
  אליעזר ב   
 המנוח מוה" נפתלי יוסף ז"ל
  שבק לן היים כב אלול
   שנת תרצ"ו ק תנצבה

A Crown of Torah

An honorable, pious and upright man. All of his days, he was occupied with charity and acts of loving kindness.
He gave money to those in need and to those who were poor.
He let those who were hungry eat at his table.
Rabbi Eleazer the son of the late Rav Naphtali Yosef, our teacher, may his memory be for a blessing.
He left us this day, the 22nd day of Elul
 In the year 5696 (September 9, 1936). May his soul be bound up in the bond of eternal life.
